conversations.system:
I want you to act as a SQL terminal in front of an example database, you need only to return the sql command to me. Below is an instruction that describes a task, Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

##Instruction:
assets_maintenance contains tables such as skills_required_to_fix, third_party_companies, maintenance_engineers, asset_parts, engineer_visits, staff, skills, engineer_skills, maintenance_contracts, assets, fault_log_parts, part_faults, fault_log, parts.
Table asset_parts has columns such as asset_id, part_id, where part_id is the primary key, asset_id is the primary key.
Table assets has columns such as asset_id, maintenance_contract_id, supplier_company_id, asset_details, asset_make, asset_model, asset_acquired_date, asset_disposed_date, other_asset_details, where maintenance_contract_id is the primary key, supplier_company_id is the primary key.
Table engineer_skills has columns such as engineer_id, skill_id, where engineer_id is the primary key, skill_id is the primary key.
Table engineer_visits has columns such as engineer_visit_id, contact_staff_id, engineer_id, fault_log_entry_id, fault_status, visit_start_datetime, visit_end_datetime, other_visit_details, where fault_log_entry_id is the primary key, engineer_id is the primary key, contact_staff_id is the primary key.
Table fault_log has columns such as fault_log_entry_id, asset_id, recorded_by_staff_id, fault_log_entry_datetime, fault_description, other_fault_details, where asset_id is the primary key, recorded_by_staff_id is the primary key.
Table fault_log_parts has columns such as fault_log_entry_id, part_fault_id, fault_status, where part_fault_id is the primary key, fault_log_entry_id is the primary key.
Table maintenance_contracts has columns such as maintenance_contract_id, maintenance_contract_company_id, contract_start_date, contract_end_date, other_contract_details, where maintenance_contract_company_id is the primary key.
Table maintenance_engineers has columns such as engineer_id, company_id, first_name, last_name, other_details, where company_id is the primary key.
Table part_faults has columns such as part_fault_id, part_id, fault_short_name, fault_description, other_fault_details, where part_id is the primary key.
Table parts has columns such as part_id, part_name, chargeable_yn, chargeable_amount, other_part_details.
Table skills has columns such as skill_id, skill_code, skill_description.
Table skills_required_to_fix has columns such as part_fault_id, skill_id, where part_fault_id is the primary key, skill_id is the primary key.
Table staff has columns such as staff_id, staff_name, gender, other_staff_details.
Table third_party_companies has columns such as company_id, company_type, company_name, company_address, other_company_details.
The part_id of parts is the foreign key of part_id of asset_parts.
The asset_id of assets is the foreign key of asset_id of asset_parts.
The maintenance_contract_id of maintenance_contracts is the foreign key of maintenance_contract_id of assets.
The company_id of third_party_companies is the foreign key of supplier_company_id of assets.
The engineer_id of maintenance_engineers is the foreign key of engineer_id of engineer_skills.
The skill_id of skills is the foreign key of skill_id of engineer_skills.
The fault_log_entry_id of fault_log is the foreign key of fault_log_entry_id of engineer_visits.
The engineer_id of maintenance_engineers is the foreign key of engineer_id of engineer_visits.
The staff_id of staff is the foreign key of contact_staff_id of engineer_visits.
The asset_id of assets is the foreign key of asset_id of fault_log.
The staff_id of staff is the foreign key of recorded_by_staff_id of fault_log.
The part_fault_id of part_faults is the foreign key of part_fault_id of fault_log_parts.
The fault_log_entry_id of fault_log is the foreign key of fault_log_entry_id of fault_log_parts.
The company_id of third_party_companies is the foreign key of maintenance_contract_company_id of maintenance_contracts.
The company_id of third_party_companies is the foreign key of company_id of maintenance_engineers.
The part_id of parts is the foreign key of part_id of part_faults.
The part_fault_id of part_faults is the foreign key of part_fault_id of skills_required_to_fix.
The skill_id of skills is the foreign key of skill_id of skills_required_to_fix.
conversations.query: Which engineer has visited the most times? Show the engineer id, first name and last name.
conversations.answer:
SELECT t1.engineer_id,
       t1.first_name,
       t1.last_name
FROM maintenance_engineers AS t1
JOIN engineer_visits AS t2
GROUP BY t1.engineer_id
ORDER BY count(*) DESC
LIMIT 1;
